title: 'F YES. Karma': Ryan Zimmerman's wife celebrates homer after Trea Turner call
text:
The wife of Washington Nationals first baseman Ryan Zimmerman spoke for a lot of Nats fans after a controversial call against Trea Turner in Tuesday night’s World Series game against the Houston Astros.

Earlier in the seventh inning, Turner was called out for interference on a throw to first base despite being in the basepath. The play would’ve given the Nationals men on 2nd and 3rd with no outs, instead they had a man on first with one out. The Nationals even filed a protest about the widely-criticized call.

Two batters later, third-baseman Anthony Rendon hit a two-run homer, largely offsetting the damage a bad call would’ve had.

Heather Zimmerman promptly tweeted what many a Nationals fan was thinking.

“F YES. Karma,” she posted on Twitter.

F YES. Karma. — Heather Zimmerman (@HeatherZiMS) October 30, 2019
